contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement <!-- See Template:Infobox settlement for additional fields and descriptions --> | name = Ida-Viru County | settlement_type = [[Counties of Estonia|County of Estonia]] | image_flag = Ida-Virumaa_lipp.svg | flag_size = 125px | image_shield = Ida-Virumaa vapp.svg | shield_size = 75px | image_map = Ida-Viru_in_Estonia.svg | subdivision_type = [[List of sovereign states|Country]] | subdivision_name = [[Estonia]] | seat_type = Capital | seat = [[Jõhvi]] | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = Ago Silde | area_total_km2 = 3364 | population_total = 168656 | population_as_of = Jan 2010<ref name="County_population" /> | population_density_km2 = auto | iso_code = EE-44 | website = | footnotes = }} '''Ida-Viru County''' ({{lang-et|Ida-Viru maakond}}), or '''''Ida-Virumaa''''', is one of 15 [[counties of Estonia|counties]] of [[Estonia]]. It is the most north-eastern part of the country. The county contains large deposits of [[oil shale]] - the main [[mineral]] mined in Estonia. As oil shale is used in [[thermal power plant]]s, the earth in Ida-Viru contains most of Estonia's energy resources. The capital of the county is the town of [[Jõhvi]] which is administratively united with the [[Jõhvi Parish]]. 168,656 people live in Ida-Viru County – constituting 12.6% of the total population in Estonia (as of January 2010).<ref name="County_population">{{cite web|url=http://pub.stat.ee/px-web.2001/Dialog/varval.asp?ma=PO0222&path=../I_Databas/Population/01Population_indicators_and_composition/04Population_figure_and_composition/&lang=1|title=Population by sex, ethnic nationality and County, 1 January|date=2010-04-19|work=stat.ee|publisher=[[Statistics Estonia]]|accessdate=2010-08-19}}</ref> == History == During the latter part of the period of [[Estonian Soviet Socialist Republic|Soviet rule of Estonia]], Ida-Virumaa was called Kohtla-Järve district, and its administrative capital was [[Kohtla-Järve]]. == County Government == The [[County Governments of Estonia|County Government]] ({{lang-et|Maavalitsus}}) is led by a [[County Governors of Estonia|Governor]] ({{lang-et|maavanem}}), who is appointed by the country's [[Government of Estonia|government]] for a term of five years. Since August 2004 the governor's position is held by [[Ago Silde]]. The current governor of Ida-Viru county is [[Riho Breivel]]. == Population == [[File:Population of Ida-Viru county (1990-2010).png|thumb|The population of Ida-Viru county has declined from 221,807 in 1990 to 168,656 in 2010.]] As of January 2010, the population of Ida-Virumaa is 168,656, which makes the second largest county in Estonia (after [[Harju County|Harjumaa]], which includes [[Tallinn]]). 44.6% of the population are men and 55.4% women.<ref name="County_population" /> By ethnic origin, 71.3% of population are [[Russians]], 19.7% are [[Estonians]], 2.7% are [[Ukrainians]], 2.7% are [[Belarusians]] and 1.4% are [[Finns]] (as of January 1, 2009).<ref name="County_population" /> == Municipalities == The county is subdivided into [[Municipalities of Estonia|municipalities]]. There are 6 urban municipalities ({{lang-et|linnad}} - towns) and 16 rural municipalities ({{lang-et|vallad}} - parishes) in Ida-Viru County. There are 217 villages in Ida-Virumaa. [[File:Ida-Viru municipalities.png|thumb|right|500px|Municipalities of Ida-Viru County]] '''Urban municipalities:''' *[[Kiviõli]] *[[Kohtla-Järve]] *[[Narva]] *[[Narva-Jõesuu]] *[[Püssi]] *[[Sillamäe]] '''Rural municipalities:''' *[[Alajõe Parish]] *[[Aseri Parish]] *[[Avinurme Parish]] *[[Iisaku Parish]] *[[Illuka Parish]] *[[Jõhvi Parish]] (''including the town of [[Jõhvi]]'') *[[Kohtla Parish]] *[[Kohtla-Nõmme]] (''borough'') *[[Lohusuu Parish]] *[[Lüganuse Parish]] *[[Maidla Parish]] *[[Mäetaguse Parish]] *[[Sonda Parish]] *[[Toila Parish]] *[[Tudulinna Parish]] *[[Vaivara Parish]] == Geography == [[File:Ida-Viru Tuhamäed.JPG|thumb|Ash hills in Ida-Viru County]] <!-- Image with unknown copyright status removed: [[File:Toila-resort-Estonia.JPG|right|thumb|369px|Park of [[Toila]] sea-resort.]] --> == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == *[http://www.ida-virumaa.ee/ Ida-Virumaa Online] *[http://www.ivmv.ee/ Ida-Viru County Government] - Official website (in Estonian and Russian, with translation to several other languages) {{Navboxes |title = <!-- [[File:Nuvola filesystems www.png|23px]] --> Geographic locale |list = {{Ida-Virumaa}} {{Counties of Estonia}} {{Cities_of_Estonia}} }} {{coord|59|13|N|27|18|E|type:adm1st_region:EE|display=title}} <!--Categories--> [[Category:Ida-Viru County| ]] [[Category:Counties of Estonia]]
